stimulusHtml: A large box of mass M is at rest on a platform of mass m, where M>m. These objects are suspended by two strings and each string passes over a separate pulley attached to the ceiling, as shown. Which of the following correctly states the number of upward forces acting on the box-platform system and provides the correct justification?
choicesHtml: Two upward forces are exerted on the system because there are two strings which exert upward forces on the system.
Two upward forces are exerted on the system because there are two pulleys which exert upward forces on the system.
Four upward forces are exerted on the system because there are two strings and two pulleys which exert upward forces on the system.
Four upward forces are exerted on the system because there are four tensions which exert upward forces on the system.
